description: Represents a calendar showing free days for appointments using a list of clusters, providers and scopes. Usually the list of clusters, providers are converted to a list of scopes. If all these lists are empty, the list of scopes is generated by available scopes for the given requests.

bookableEnd.description: unix timestamp of a day representing the end of the bookable time. Paging after thise date should reveal no new appointments.

items.description: A cluster is a way to group different scopes.

example.callDisplayText:
Herzlich Willkommen,
Die aufgerufenen Plätze finden Sie den im Gang rechts.
example.name: Bürger- und Standesamt

callDisplayText.description: text for the call display if only the cluster is selected

hint.description: information for the client like the address to a cluster location

shortNameEnabled.description: true if the scope short name should be display next to the workstation name

items.description: Representation of a day in the calendar. You might find curious values in freeAppointments. While callcenter and public values might be positive, the intern value can be negative. This is due to calculation. The public and callcenter values are calculated per slot whereas the intern value is calculated for the whole day/all summed scopes. If the intern value is lower 0 and beyond, some slots might be booked with more clients than available. This might be due to changes in the availability settings.

processList.description: list of processes, only available if status is detail

status.description:
Status of day. The following values are possible:
  * bookable: day has free appointments
  * notBookable: day is not bookable because of missing availabilities
  * restricted: not bookable because of dayoff times
  * full: not bookable because missing free appointments
  * detail: non calculated status, every process for the day is available unter processList (very expansive in resources, use with caution)

firstDay.description: Representation of a day in the calendar. You might find curious values in freeAppointments. While callcenter and public values might be positive, the intern value can be negative. This is due to calculation. The public and callcenter values are calculated per slot whereas the intern value is calculated for the whole day/all summed scopes. If the intern value is lower 0 and beyond, some slots might be booked with more clients than available. This might be due to changes in the availability settings.

status.description:

  * restricted: not bookable because of dayoff times
  * full: not bookable because missing free appointments
  * detail: non calculated status, every process for the day is available unter processList (very expansive in resources, use with caution)

While callcenter and public values might be positive, the intern value can be negative. This is due to calculation. The public and callcenter values are calculated per slot whereas the intern value is calculated for the whole day/all summed scopes. If the intern value is lower 0 and beyond, some slots might be booked with more clients than available. This might be due to changes in the availability settings.

status.description:

items.description: A provider usually represents an organisational entity offering services to clients. In most cases, it is a building or a special location hosting an organisation which provides the services. A service is represented by a request in the ZMS.

link.description: URI with detailed information for the provider

name.description: name of the referenced service (explicit redundant)

source.description: source of provider to resolve reference id

items.description: A request is usually a representation of a service offered by a provider.

meta.keywords: Abmeldung, Wohnungsabmeldung, Wegzug, abmelden, Wohnsitz, Wohnung abmelden, Wohnungswechsel, Umzug, Adressänderung, ummelden

data.process_time: Bei persönlicher Vorsprache in einem Bürgeramt wird die Abmeldung abschließend bearbeitet.

requirements.description:
Die Abmeldung kann auch auf dem Postweg erfolgen.
Bitte benutzen Sie dazu aber das angebotene Formular.
Bei mehr als 3 abzumeldenden Personen benutzen Sie bitte weitere Meldescheine.
requirements.name: Abmeldung bei der Meldebehörde

requirements.description:
Seit dem 1. November 2015 ist der Wohnungsgeber verpflichtet, dem Meldepflichtigen den Auszug bis zu 7 Tage vor oder nach dem Auszug schriftlich mit Unterschrift zu bestätigen. Die Bestätigung muss folgende Daten enthalten: Name und Anschrift des Wohnungsgebers, Auszugsdatum, Anschrift der Wohnung und Namen der meldepflichtigen Personen.
Ein Muster für die Auszugsbestätigung des Wohnungsgebers steht Ihnen unter "Formulare" zur Verfügung.
requirements.name: Auszugsbestätigung des Wohnungsgebers (Vermieter)

data.responsibility: Diese Dienstleistung erhalten Sie in allen Berliner Bürgerämtern.
data.fees: gebührenfrei; dies gilt auch für die Abmeldebestätigung.
data.description:
• Sie geben eine Berliner Wohnung auf, weil Sie in das Ausland verziehen

oder
  • Sie geben eine von mehreren Wohnungen in Deutschland auf, für die Sie angemeldet sind und die Berliner Wohnung bleibt bestehen
oder
  • Sie geben eine von mehreren Berliner Wohnungen auf, für die Sie angemeldet sind

Sie müssen sich bei der Meldebehörde in Berlin nur bei einem Wegzug ins Ausland abmelden oder bei der Aufgabe einer Haupt- oder Nebenwohnung, ohne dass Sie in eine andere Wohnung im Inland einziehen.
Beim Wegzug in das Ausland gilt, dass Sie aus dieser Wohnung ausziehen und dort zukünftig nicht wieder wohnen werden - befristete Auslandsaufenthalte, z.B. zu Studienzwecken bedingen keine Abmeldung.


Die Abmeldung kann im Zeitraum von 7 Tagen vor, muss aber bis 14 Tage nach dem Auszug vorgenommen werden.
Sie erhalten eine Abmeldebestätigung.

Hinweis:
Wenn Sie jedoch innerhalb Deutschlands nur umziehen wollen, brauchen Sie sich lediglich bei der Meldebehörde Ihrer neuen Wohnung anmelden.
data.name: Abmeldung einer Wohnung

link.description: URI with detailed information for the request

group.description: name of a group for grouping requests

name.description: name of the referenced service (explicit redundant)

source.description: source of the service to resolve reference id

timeSlotCount.description: number of time slots assumend for the request

items.description: A process represents a request from one or more clients, usually including an appointment. Compared to an appointment, the process has additional information about the status of the request from the client.

amendment.description: additional information for this process from the client

customTextfield.description: additional information for this process from the client

archiveId.description: Number is used to identify a process in an archive (for statistical purposes)

authKey.description: key for client to delete or change process

createTimestamp.description: unix timestamp representing creation of the process

id.description: Number is used to identify appointments like on call displays

lastChange.description: unix timestamp of the last change on this process

status.description:
Status of the process. The following values are possible:
  * free: open for reservation
  * reserved: for updating data, no validation yet
  * confirmed: appointment
  * queued: confirmed and in waiting queue
  * called: show on call displays
  * processing: client appeared and gets service
  * pending: client has to return to fetch papers
  * pickup: client is called to fetch papers
  * finished: successfully processed
  * missed: no client appeared
  * archived: only used in statistics
  * deleted: blocking appointment time
  * anonymized: for statistically purposes only
  * blocked: to avoid the reuse of IDs on the same day
  * conflict: mark process as conflict for check functions

items.description: A scope is the central unit for processing requests for clients. It is usally a building or a special location offering workstations to serve the clients. According to the availabilities a scope has, appointments are possible. With a calldisplay and a ticketprinter it can serve clients without an appointment.

notifications.confirmationContent: Ihr Termin wurde erfolgreich gebucht mit der Nummer:
notifications.headsUpContent: Ihr Termin wird bald aufgerufen, begeben Sie sich zum Warteraum.

queue.callDisplayText:
Herzlich Willkommen,
Haben Sie bitte ein wenig Geduld, bis ihre Wartenummer aufgerufen wird.

survey.emailContent: Sehr geehrte/r Herr/Frau ###CLIENTNAME###. Wir würden uns sehr freuen, wenn Sie an der Umfrage teilnehmen würden: Zur Umfrage. Standort ###PROVIDERNAME### (###SCOPE###/###PROVIDERID###), Termin ###DATE### ###TIME### gebucht ###RESERVETIME### mit Dienstleistungen ###REQUESTCSV###.
survey.label: Teilnahme an der Kundenzufriedensheits-Umfrage

ticketprinter.deactivatedText: Dies Ausgabe von Wartenummern wurde bereits vorzeitig geschlossen, wir bitten um ihr Verständnis.

hint.description: hint for the client like a description where to find the scope

source.description: source of provider to resolve reference id

lastChange.description: unix timestamp of the last change on this scope

deallocationDuration.description: minutes before an deleted appointment is free for booking again to prevent appointment trading

multipleSlotsEnabled.description: true if more than one timeslot per appointment is allowed

notificationConfirmationEnabled.description: true if client should get a notification to confirm that notifications are enabled for him/her (Convienient preferences, see department for origin)

notificationHeadsUpEnabled.description: true if client should get a notification as reminder (Convienient preferences, see department for origin)

reservationDuration.description: minutes an appointment can have the status reserved

startInDaysDefault.description: number of days relative to today to start offering appointments

endInDaysDefault.description: maximum number of days in the future to offer appointments

alternateAppointmentUrl.description: redirect url if client should book appointments over a specialised application

amendmentLabel.description: label for the form field to enter additional informations to a process

amendmentActivated.description: true if an amendment is activated

customTextfieldLabel.description: label for the form field to enter additional informations to a process

customTextfieldActivated.description: true if an custom textfield is activated

emailFrom.description: Mail address for sending mails to clients

messages.pattern: Die E-Mail Adresse muss eine valide E-Mail im Format max@mustermann.de sein

emailRequired.description: true if client is required to enter an email address

telephoneActivated.description: true if client is allowed to enter a telephone number

telephoneRequired.description: true if client is required to enter a telephone number

confirmationContent.description: text to send to client to confirm the appointment

headsUpTime.description: minutes before call to send a sms to the client

headsUpContent.description: text to send a short time before a call

alternateName.description: alternate text to display on call display if pickup of documents is required

isDefault.description: a pickup of documents is default, this scope is preselected for pickup

callCountMax.description: number of calls before a process is removed from the queue

callDisplayText.description: text displayed at the right side on the call display

firstNumber.description: fist possible waiting number for ticket printer

lastNumber.description: last possible waiting number for ticket printer

maxNumberContingent.description: contingent of given waiting numbers for ticket printer per day

publishWaitingTimeEnabled.description: true if waiting times are allowed to be published for public use

processingTimeAverage.description: minutes average for completing a process, used to estimate waiting time

emailContent.description: content of an email to send to a client if he accepted to participate in a survey

enabled.description: true if clients should be asked to participate in a survey

label.description: text to display next to the checkbox asking the client to participate in the survey

confirmationEnabled.description: true if client should get a notification to confirm that notifications are enabled for him/her

deactivatedText.description: text to display on the ticket printer, if all ticket printers are disabled

notificationsAmendmentEnabled.description: true if a client is allowed to enter a notfication address after getting his waiting number

notificationsEnabled.description: true if notifications for calling up clients are enabled. A client is allowed to enter a telephone number if waitingtime is greater than notificationDelay.

notificationsDelay.description: minutes of calculated waiting time before a client is able to enter a notification address

emergencyEnabled.description: true if an emergency button should be displayed on workstation screens

emergencyRefreshInterval.description: number of seconds until next emergency testing

shortName.description: short identifier to differentiate between nearly identical scopes

emergency.description: If activated, a workstation has an emergency-button to call for help

acceptedByWorkstation.description: name of workstation which accepted the emergency call

calledByWorkstation.description: name of workstation where the emergency occured

givenNumberCount.description: counter for given waiting numbers for the current day

workstationCount.description: a calculated number of workstations to calculate waiting times, if ghostWorkstationCount < 1, real logged in workstations are used

lastGivenNumberTimestamp.description: unix timestamp of the last given waiting number

deactivated.description: true if all ticket printers are disabled
